page.title: 12TRADE & TOURISM IN LAUGHARNE
page.content: Apart from food shops and a newsagent most businesses (eg 3 'antiques' shops) are 'up-market' or geared to the tourist. The Sub-Post Office is combined with a dispensing chemist and Off-Licence. Some weekly shopping is done in Carmarthen or St Clears. Fish and cockles caught and sold locally and at Milford Haven. Sea-weed is gathered by Land Rover in West Wales and taken to W Glam. to make lava bread. Farm produce is sold at local marts, milk by tanker to Whitland factory. Business boosted by large numbers of tourists staying in 1 of 2 caravan and chalet parks, touring caravan and tent sites, holiday cottages/flats/guest houses. Many tour in coach/car and see Dylan Thomas's Boathouse, Castle, Church, beautiful scenery and waterfront and wonderful birdlife.
